meanings.definition: Not giving or indicating a good chance of success; unfavorable.
meanings.sent1: The stormy weather was unpropitious for our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The unpropitious news of budget cuts dampened the team's spirits.
meanings.sent3: It was unpropitious that the cat knocked over the ladder just as I was about to climb it.
meanings.sent4: The unpropitious timing of the power outage caused chaos during the important presentation.
meanings.sent5: The unpropitious forecast of heavy rain forced us to cancel the outdoor event.

meanings.sent1: The unpropitious coin toss determined who would go first in the game.
meanings.sent2: Her unpropitious choice of shoes led to blisters after just a short walk.
meanings.sent3: It was unpropitious that the black cat crossed our path right before the job interview.
meanings.sent4: The unpropitious timing of the traffic jam made him miss his flight.
meanings.sent5: The unpropitious timing of the rain ruined the outdoor wedding ceremony.

meanings.definition: Not likely to be successful or happy.
meanings.sent1: The unpropitious start to the day with a flat tire set the tone for a challenging day.
meanings.sent2: Her unpropitious investment in the failing company resulted in financial loss.
meanings.sent3: It was unpropitious that the cake fell on the floor just as the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The unpropitious decision to trust a stranger with the secret led to betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The unpropitious outcome of the experiment surprised the researchers.
